p.em: The Chehalis School District believes that motivated students, enthusiastic instruction, along with involved parents and community make a winning combination to produce well-educated young people. We are dramatically raising the expectations of future successes for our students by improving & modernizing our instructional practices and creating a school culture that prepares students for careers and post-secondary education after high school. We achieve to:

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_1 fusion-builder-column-3 fusion-one-full fusion-column-first fusion-column-last 1_1

div.p: Improve student achievement by increasing the quality of instructional practice, classroom organization, professional development and teaching effectiveness

Modernize instructional practice, improve modeling for students of the power and leverage of technology, improve internal and external communications, and enhance overall district efficiency through the use of technology.
Students exit the Chehalis School District genuinely prepared to succeed in college or a meaningful career by earning a diploma acknowledging this preparedness.

div.class: fusion-title title fusion-title-5 sep-underline sep-dotted fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-two

div.div:
3D Printing to Keep Hospital Staff Safe
Last week, CTE Director Rick Goble was contacted by Oliver Lyles of Nucor Steel in Seattle. Mr. Lyles was looking to partner with schools in order to use their 3D printers to manufacture personal protective equipment (PPE) for Washington hospitals. Mr. Lyles also serves as an assistant girls wrestling coach at W. F. West High School. Mr. Goble connected the Nucor Steel Company to W.F. West CTE teacher Randy Smith who happily agreed to work with Mr. Lyles and the project was underway. Mr. Smith enlisted his brother Jason Smith and they are now 3D printing the visors needed for face shields to be used by healthcare professionals. The first batch of visors were picked up by Nucor Steel on Tuesday. Currently, Randy and Jason have 13 printers up and running and are kindly volunteering their time to assist our Washington PPE needs during this pandemic.
check out the video - https://youtu.be/FX2y069w5uk
Latest message from State Superintendent Reykdal... https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YVC7Dtq8c2E&feature=youtu.be

div.p: If you are unable to access any information or functionality provided on this website, please email the District Office at comments@chehalisschools.org or call (360) 807-7200 for assistance.

div.class: pum pum-overlay pum-theme-14730 pum-theme-cutting-edge popmake-overlay auto_open click_open
pum-container popmake theme-14730 pum-responsive pum-responsive-medium responsive size-medium
div.div: All schools CLOSED through the end of the school year

p.strong: All Chehalis School District schools will be closed through the end of the school year. Distance learning will continue.

div.p: During the school closure, grab and go meals will be offered for anyone ages 18 and under at no cost, from Mon.-Fri., 11:00 am to 1:00 pm.
We expect to prepare 500 meals on the first day of service and will adjust our figures on future days based on participation.
